task.title: Create a Deliverable in Oxygen Content Fusion
task.shortdesc: This task will show you how to turn your content into a deliverable using GitHub, Netlify, and Oxygen Content Fusion.

taskbody.prereq: You must have connected your project from Oxygen Content Fusion to Netlify.
taskbody.context: Here you will learn how to create a deliverable in Oxygen Content Fusion.

step.cmd: In Oxygen Content Fusion, click the project name at the top left of the screen to ensure you are outside of your personal workspace.

fig.title: Screen capture of how to exit the personal workspace

image.alt: Exit your personal workspace in Oxygen Content Fusion by clicking the title of the project at the upper left-hand corner of the screen.

step.cmd: Select the “Deliverables” tab on the left, then select “new deliverable.” A pop-up will emerge, where you will set up your deliverable.

fig.title: Screen capture of the location of the "Deliverables" tab

image.alt: Select the "Deliverables" tab on the left side of the screen.

fig.title: Screen capture of the "new deliverable" button

image.alt: Select the blue "new deliverable" button to the right of the screen.

fig.title: Screen capture of the "new deliverable" pop up

image.alt: Fill out the deliverable pop up.

substep.cmd: Give your deliverable a title, and add a description if you’d like, then use the drop down menu to select the publication you made previously.
Make sure that “automatically trigger build” is selected so that your website updates automatically any time a change is made.
Select the type of deliverable you want to create: “WebHelp” for a website, or “PDF” for a PDF.
Select a template to give the deliverable your desired color palette.
Select “upload output using a publishing connector,” select the connector you made before from the drop-down, and click “save.”

step.cmd: On the deliverable you just made, click “build,” then go to Netlify.

fig.title: Screen capture of a created deliverable

image.alt: Click build at the upper right corner of the deliverable you made

fig.title: Screen capture of where to find your site in Netlify

image.alt: In Netlify, select your project in the bottom middle of your profile's screen.

substep.cmd: A link to your website or PDF should be there, which you can follow to see your deliverable.

fig.title: Screen capture of the link to your website

image.alt: Follow the link to your deliverable near the top of the screen.

substep.cmd: If you want to, select "site configuration" and select "change site name" on the “site information” box to change the site url from the one automatically generated by Netlify.

fig.title: Screen capture of where to find "site configuration"

image.alt: Select "site configuration" on the left side of the screen.

fig.title: Screen capture showing how to change the site name

image.alt: On the "site configuration" screen, select "change site name" towards the bottom to customize your url.

info.note: This step is optional, but recommended.
